Vasoactive intestinal polypeptide (VIP) is a systemic and coronary vasodilator that may have positive inotropic properties.

"Systemic" and "coronary" refer to the areas where the effect of VIP occurs, not to specific diseases. "Vasodilator" describes a property of a substance that causes the dilation of blood vessels, but it is not a disease itself. "Positive inotropic properties" refers to the ability of a substance to increase the force of heart muscle contractions, which can be beneficial in certain heart conditions, but it is not a disease either.
